text:
I remember my childhood as a time of exploration, learning and adventure. I grew up in a small town in the Midwest, surrounded by rolling hills and vast fields of corn. I was an introverted child, preferring the company of myself and my imagination in the solitude of our family’s farmhouse. But I also had a deep curiosity and openness to experience, which led me to explore the world around me.

I often wandered in the fields, searching for animals and plants I had never seen before. I was always in awe of the beauty of nature and the mysteries of the world. I loved collecting rocks and sticks, which I would later use for my art projects. I was also an avid reader, devouring books about science, history, and nature.

My parents were both very supportive of my interests, encouraging me to explore and learn more about the world. I had access to many educational materials, such as books, magazines, and documentaries. We also frequently visited museums, zoos, and other attractions. 

During the summer months, I spent my time exploring the creek near our farm. I was fascinated by the life underneath the water, catching fish and studying the different types of aquatic plants. I also enjoyed spending time in the garden, planting flowers and vegetables with my parents and learning about the importance of sustainability.

I also enjoyed spending time outdoors, playing tag and hide and seek with my friends. I was always the one who found the best hiding places! I had a natural talent for problem-solving, and I loved coming up with creative solutions. 

As I got older, I developed a deep appreciation for the arts, and I became involved in theatre and music. I loved expressing myself through creative outlets. I was also passionate about social justice and activism, and I was often found attending protests and rallies. 

Throughout my childhood, I experienced many hardships and struggles, but I was always able to find solace in my creativity and my love for learning. I found joy in the small things and beauty in the world around me. I was an introverted, agreeable, unconscientious, neurotic, and open to experience child, and these qualities have shaped who I am today.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
